meanings.definition: An area where bricks are made or stored.
meanings.sent1: The workers unloaded the bricks at the brickfields.
meanings.sent2: The community built a new house using bricks from the brickfields.
meanings.sent3: The children played hide-and-seek among the stacks of bricks in the brickfields.
meanings.sent4: The brickfields were a treasure trove of building materials.
meanings.sent5: The sun set over the vast expanse of the brickfields, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: A place where bricks are manufactured.
meanings.sent1: The brickfields hummed with the sound of machinery producing bricks.
meanings.sent2: The company invested in new equipment to increase production at the brickfields.
meanings.sent3: Visitors marveled at the efficiency of the automated systems in the brickfields.
meanings.sent4: The brickfields were a hive of activity, churning out bricks day and night.
meanings.sent5: The workers took pride in their work at the brickfields, knowing each brick would be part of a new building.

meanings.definition: A field where bricks are produced.
meanings.sent1: The brickfields stretched out before them, rows of clay waiting to be molded into bricks.
meanings.sent2: The farmers converted their land into a profitable brickfields.
meanings.sent3: The animals grazed peacefully near the edge of the brickfields.
meanings.sent4: The brickfields seemed to blend seamlessly with the surrounding countryside.
meanings.sent5: The workers toiled under the hot sun, turning the clay into bricks in the expansive brickfields.
